required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Young Adult Education on Alcohol & Health
clinical_study.official_title: A Technology-based Intervention for Alcohol-related Sexual Risk Behaviors in Young Women

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this clinical trial is to test whether participants will complete our brief online program (feasibility) and then tell us what it was like going through it (acceptability).

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 50 participants will complete this 5 week study. The study will include a background survey, the 4 week program focused on alcohol and sexual health, and a follow-up survey asking what it was like going through it.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants will complete the online program.

primary_outcome.description: Feasibility will be assessed as ease of recruitment during the study as well as ability to retain participants during the intervention portion of the study.
Acceptability will be assessed in the follow-up survey through participant feedback on relevance of the intervention, engagement with the material, skill implementation, suggestions for improvement.

secondary_outcome.description: Using items from the Sexual Health Questionnaire, we will assess the quantity and frequency of drinking before sex.
Using items from the Sexual Health Questionnaire, we will assess number of sexual partners (casual, committed).
Using items from the Sexual Health Questionnaire, we will assess the frequency of condom use during penetrative sex.
Using the Daily Drinking Questionnaire, we will assess typical drinking quantity and frequency.

arm_group.description: All participants in this pilot trial will receive the intervention

intervention.description: The online program is 4 weeks and focused on topics such as alcohol and sexual health

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women ages 18-24
- Not engaged or married
- Report an unwanted sexual experience in their lifetime
- Report consuming at least three alcohol drinks per week in past 6 months
- Report heavy episodic drinking (4+ drinks on one occasion) at least once in past 6 months
- Report SRB with men (multiple/casual partners, inconsistent condom use) in the 6 months
- Have a valid email address
Exclusion Criteria:
- Do not want to participate

eligibility.gender_description: Enrollment is based on female birth sex and female gender identity

responsible_party.investigator_title: Postdoctoral Scholar, School of Medicine: Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences
